SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To report a case of amiodarone-induced thyrotoxicosis (AIT) concomitant with thyroid cancer in multinodular goiter (MNG)
CLINICAL PRESENTATION AND INTERVENTION: A 61-year-old man treated with amiodarone for 5 years presented with mild sweating
He was found to have AIT simultaneously with thyroid papillary cancer and MNG
Administration of amiodarone was stopped, and he was treated with methimazole for AIT
Five weeks after the initial treatment, thyroid function normalized
Total thyroidectomy was considered to enable use of amiodarone again
CONCLUSION: This case showed that thyrotoxicosis, MNG and amiodarone may contribute to thyroid carcinogenesis
Amiodarone should be carefully commenced in cases with MNG
